@description.body:

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The menu is a popup like control which supports buttons. It comes with full keyboard navigation and an improved timeout based pointer control behavior. This class is the container for all derived instances of {@link qx.ui.menu.AbstractButton}.

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: slidebar {qx.ui.menu.MenuSlideBar} shows a slidebar to easily navigate inside the menu (if too little space is left)
@childControl.description: shows a slidebar to easily navigate inside the menu (if too little space is left)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The spacing between each cell of the menu buttons

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The spacing between each menu button

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Default icon column width if no icons are rendered. This property is ignored as soon as an icon is present.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Default arrow column width if no sub menus are rendered

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Color of the blocker

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Opacity of the blocker

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The currently selected button

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The currently opened button (sub menu is visible)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Widget that opened the menu

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Interval in ms after which sub menus should be opened

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Interval in ms after which sub menus should be closed

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Blocks the background if value is true

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Position of the aligned object in relation to the opener. Please note than changes to this property are only applied when re-aligning the widget. The first part of the value is the edge to attach to. The second part the alignment of the orthogonal edge after the widget has been attached. The default value "bottom-left" for example means that the widget should be shown directly under the given target and then should be aligned to be left edge: 

 +--------+
 | target |
 +--------+
 +-------------+
 |   widget    |
 +-------------+

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget should be placed relative to an other widget or to the pointer.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget should moved using DOM methods.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Selects the algorithm to place the widget horizontally. direct uses {@link qx.util.placement.DirectAxis}, keep-align uses {@link qx.util.placement.KeepAlignAxis} and best-fit uses {@link qx.util.placement.BestFitAxis}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Selects the algorithm to place the widget vertically. direct uses {@link qx.util.placement.DirectAxis}, keep-align uses {@link qx.util.placement.KeepAlignAxis} and best-fit uses {@link qx.util.placement.BestFitAxis}.

@description.name: @description

@description.body: Right offset of the pointer (in pixel)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Bottom offset of the pointer (in pixel)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Offsets in one group

@param.description: Coordinate of any point with the keys left and top.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Updates the visibility of the slidebar based on the menu's current size and position.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Schedules the addition of the slidebar and calls the given callback after the slidebar has been added.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: callback {Function} the callback to call

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var|undefined} The return value of the callback if the slidebar already exists, or undefined if it doesn't
@return.description: The return value of the callback if the slidebar already exists, or undefined if it doesn't

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the location data like {qx.bom.element.Location#get} does, but does not rely on DOM elements coordinates to be rendered. Instead, this method works with the available layout data available in the moment when it is executed. This works best when called in some type of resize or move event which are supported by all widgets out of the box.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: widget {qx.ui.core.Widget} Any widget

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map|null} Returns a map with left, top, right and bottom which contains the distance of the widget relative coords the document.
@return.description: Returns a map with left, top, right and bottom which contains the distance of the widget relative coords the document.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the position. Uses low-level, high-performance DOM methods when the property {@link #domMove} is enabled. Checks if an always visible element is set and moves the widget to not overlay the always visible widget if possible. The algorithm tries to move the widget as far left as necessary but not of the screen. ({@link #setVisibleElement})

@param.name: @param
@param.body: left {Integer} The left position

@param.name: @param
@param.body: top {Integer} The top position

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Places the widget to another (at least laid out) widget. The DOM element is not needed, but the bounds are needed to compute the location of the widget to align to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: target {qx.ui.core.Widget} Target coords align coords

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
liveupdate {Boolean} Flag indicating if the position of the
 widget should be checked and corrected automatically.
@param.description:
Flag indicating if the position of the
 widget should be checked and corrected automatically.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the widget was successfully placed
@return.description: true if the widget was successfully placed

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes all resources allocated by the last run of placeToWidget with liveupdate=true

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Places the widget to the pointer position.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: event {qx.event.type.Pointer} Pointer event to align to

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Places the widget to any (rendered) DOM element.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: elem {Element} DOM element to align to

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
liveupdate {Boolean} Flag indicating if the position of the
 widget should be checked and corrected automatically.
@param.description:
Flag indicating if the position of the
 widget should be checked and corrected automatically.

@param.body: point {Map} Coordinate of any point with the keys left and top.
@param.description: Coordinate of any point with the keys left and top.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the placement offsets as a map

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the size of the object to place. The callback will be called with the size as first argument. This methods works asynchronously. The size of the object to place is the size of the widget. If a widget including this mixin needs a different size it can implement the method _computePlacementSize, which returns the size.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
callback {Function} This function will be called with the size as
    first argument
@param.description:
This function will be called with the size as
    first argument

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Internal method to read specific this properties and apply the results to the this afterwards.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: coords {Map} Location of the object to align the this to. This map should have the keys left, top, right and bottom.
@param.description: Location of the object to align the this to. This map should have the keys left, top, right and bottom.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Forward the call with the given function name to the children container

@param.name: @param
@param.body: functionName {String} name of the method to forward
@param.description: name of the method to forward

@param.name: @param
@param.body: a1 {var?} first argument of the method to call
@param.description: first argument of the method to call

@param.name: @param
@param.body: a2 {var?} second argument of the method to call
@param.description: second argument of the method to call

@param.name: @param
@param.body: a3 {var?} third argument of the method to call
@param.description: third argument of the method to call

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The return value of the forward method
@return.description: The return value of the forward method

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the children list

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.ui.core.LayoutItem[]} The children array (Arrays are
   reference types, please do not modify them in-place)
@return.description:
The children array (Arrays are
   reference types, please do not modify them in-place)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget contains children.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Returns true when the widget has children.
@return.description: Returns true when the widget has children.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a new child widget. The supported keys of the layout options map depend on the layout manager used to position the widget. The options are documented in the class documentation of each layout manager {@link qx.ui.layout}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} the item to add.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove the given child item.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} the item to remove

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove all children.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Array} An array containing the removed children.
@return.description: An array containing the removed children.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the index position of the given item if it is a child item. Otherwise it returns -1. This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} the item to query for

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The index position or -1 when the given item is no child of this layout.
@return.description: The index position or -1 when the given item is no child of this layout.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add a child at the specified index This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} item to add

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index, at which the item will be inserted
@param.description: Index, at which the item will be inserted

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add an item before another already inserted item This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} item to add

@param.name: @param
@param.body: before {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} item before the new item will be inserted.
@param.description: item before the new item will be inserted.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add an item after another already inserted item This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} item to add

@param.name: @param
@param.body: after {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} item, after which the new item will be inserted
@param.description: item, after which the new item will be inserted

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove the item at the specified index. This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index of the item to remove.
@param.description: Index of the item to remove.
